column1: Dinhata is a city and a municipality in Cooch Behar district in the state of West Bengal
column2: India. It is the headquarters of the Dinhata subdivision.

column1: Dinhata is located at 26.13°N 89.47°E﻿ / 26.13; 89.47. It has an average elevation of 36 metres (118 feet).
According to the District Census Handbook 2011
column3: Dinhata covered an area of 4.55 km2.

column1: The map alongside shows the eastern part of the district. In Tufanganj subdivision 6.97% of the population lives in the urban areas and 93.02% lives in the rural areas. In Dinhata subdivision 5.98% of the population lives in the urban areas and 94.02% lives in the urban areas.The entire district forms the flat alluvial flood plains of mighty rivers.Note: The map alongside presents some of the notable locations in the subdivisions. All places marked in the map are linked in the larger full screen map.

column1: Dinhata police station has jurisdiction over Dinhata municipal area and Dinhata I CD block.
The headquarters of the Dinhata I CD block are located at Dinhata town.
The total number of wards in the municipality are 16.
Dinhata College was established in 1956. Affiliated with the Cooch Behar Panchanan Barma University
